text:
Do you support Xerces under the Microsoft JVM? If so, do you have example code 
in incorporating it, as I'm having difficulties doing so.

I'm running into a java.lang.NoSuchClassDefError on trying to load the 
SAXParser. I've even attempted repackaging the xerces.jar as a .cab file.
Is there any other method other than using the Sun java plug-in?
creator: alian@trakus.com
sandygao@ca.ibm.com
text:
While I don't have answers to the question, I believe it shouldn't be list as a 
bug. There is a better chance to get an answer if the question is posted to the 
Xerces-j-user mailing list.
